page.title: Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show

revision.comment: /* Release history */[[User:Monkbot/Task_6:_CS1_language_support|Task 6k]]: add |script-title=; replace {{xx icon}} with |language= in CS1 citations; clean up language icons;
revision.text:
{{Infobox album | Name = Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show | Type = ep | Artist = [[Characters of Glee#Casting|''Glee'' Cast]] | Cover = RockyHorrorGleeShow.png | Alt = The words "The Rocky Horror Glee Show" are written in bold on a blue-black background. All words are red with the exception of "Glee", which is white. | Released = {{Start date|2010|10|19}}
(see [[#Release history|release history]]) | Recorded = 2010 | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]], [[soundtrack]] | Length = {{Duration|m=21|s=27}} | Label = [[Columbia Records|Columbia]] / [[Fox Music|20th Century Fox TV]] | Producer = [[Dante Di Loreto]] ([[Executive producer#Music|exec.]]), [[Brad Falchuk]] (exec.), [[Adam Anders]], [[Peer Åström]], [[Ryan Murphy (writer)|Ryan Murphy]] | Reviews = | Last album = ''[[Glee: The Music, Journey to Regionals]]''
(2010) | This album = '''''Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show'''''
(2010) | Next album = ''[[Glee: The Music, The Christmas Album]]''
(2010) }} '''''Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show''''' is the third [[extended play]] (EP) by the cast of the musical television series ''[[Glee (TV series)|Glee]]'', released on October 19, 2010. It contains seven songs and accompanies the episode "[[The Rocky Horror Glee Show]]", originally aired October 26, 2010 on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]. The Halloween episode sees the [[glee club]] recreating the 1973 [[comedy horror]] musical ''[[The Rocky Horror Show]]'', written and composed by [[Richard O'Brien]].{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio2/shows/paige/essentialvote.shtml|title=He’s O.K.: ‘Rocky Horror’ Creator Given Residency in New Zealand|date=September 7, 2010|first=Dave|last=Itzkoff|work=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=[[The New York Times Company]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} [[Dante Di Loreto]] and [[Brad Falchuk]] serve as the [[Executive producer#Music|executive producers]]. ==Background and development== The ''Glee'' episode "[[The Rocky Horror Glee Show]]" originally aired October 26, 2010 as part of [[Fox Broadcasting Corporation|Fox]]'s series of [[Halloween]]-themed episodes, and features a staging of ''[[The Rocky Horror Show]]'' by the school's glee club.{{Cite press release|url=http://www.foxflash.com/div.php/main/page?aID=1z2z2z320z1z8&ID=7045|title=''Haunt'' from Fox: Halloween is spook-tacularly funny with two nights of thrills on Fox|date=October 7, 2010|publisher=[[Fox Broadcasting Company]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}{{Cite press release|url=http://www.foxflash.com/div.php/main/page?aID=1z4&mo=10&d=25|title=Let's do The Time Warp again on an all-new "Glee"|publisher=[[Fox Broadcasting Company]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} Plans for the episode were revealed at the 2010 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] by ''Glee'' creator [[Ryan Murphy (writer)|Ryan Murphy]] after cast member [[Chris Colfer]] expressed desire to cover "[[Time Warp (song)|Time Warp]]" on the show.{{Cite news|url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2010/07/comiccon-2010-glee-will-do-rocky-horror-episode-.html|title=COMIC-CON 2010: 'Glee' will do 'Rocky Horror' episode|date=July 25, 2010|first=Scott|last=Collins|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tribune Company]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} [[Jayma Mays]], who plays the role of guidance counselor [[Emma Pillsbury]], auditioned with "[[Touch-a, Touch-a, Touch-a, Touch Me]]" and performs the song, with some changes in lyrics.{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-gleestage26-2009apr26,0,1653470.story|title='Glee' team rewrites the school musical|date=April 26, 2009|first=Denise|last=Martin|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tribune Company]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://popwatch.ew.com/2010/10/15/glee-rocky-horror-stamos/|title='Glee' does 'Rocky Horror': Listen to the previews here!|date=October 15, 2010|first=Margaret|last=Lyons|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|publisher=[[Time Inc.|Time Inc]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} "I'm so going to have to get her to do that on the show," said Murphy on her audition piece.{{Cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-gleestage26-2009apr26,0,1653470.story|title='Glee' team rewrites the school musical|date=April 26, 2009|first=Denise|last=Martin|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|publisher=[[Tribune Company]]|accessdate=October 20, 2010}} "[[Hot Patootie – Bless My Soul|Whatever Happened to Saturday Night]]" is sung by [[John Stamos]], and "[[Dammit Janet|Damn It, Janet]]" by [[Cory Monteith]] and [[Lea Michele]]. The EP's tracklist was announced in an official press release on September 28, 2010. It was released digitally and physically on October 19, 2010 in North America.{{Cite press release|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/glee-the-music-the-rocky-horror-glee-show-in-stores-october-19-103922393.html|title=Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show in Stores October 19|date=September 28, 2010|publisher=[[PR Newswire]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/956052/glee-announces-rocky-horror-album-details|title='Glee' Announces 'Rocky Horror' Album Details|date=September 28, 2010|first=Jason|last=Lipshutz|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} ==Reception== Andrew Leahey of [[allmusic]] gave a rating of three-and-a-half stars out of five, calling the EP "one of the better recordings in ''Glee''{{'}}s catalog" and "a tidy, polished, well-sung tribute album." He praised the performances of [[Naya Rivera]], [[Jayma Mays]], and [[John Stamos]], vocalists infrequently heard on the series, but felt the casting of [[Amber Riley]] as Dr. Frank-N-Furter was misplaced.{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=glee-the-music-the-rocky-horror-glee-show-r2027059/review|pure_url=yes}}|title=Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show - Review|first=Andrew|last=Leahey|publisher=[[allmusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]|accessdate=October 18, 2010}} ''Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show'' debuted at number six on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] the week of October 27, 2010, with 48,000 copies sold, the lowest debut and sales for the cast in the United States.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/952529/sugarland-tops-kings-of-leon-on-billboard-200|title=Sugarland Tops Kings of Leon on Billboard 200|date=October 27, 2010|first=Keith|last=Caulfield|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc|accessdate=October 27, 2010}} This debut made ''Glee'' the first television series to have six or more soundtracks chart in the chart's top ten, and marked the highest position ever reached for a ''Rocky Horror'' album.{{cite web|url=http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/68460/week-ending-oct-24-2010-place-your-bets/|title=Week Ending Oct. 24, 2010: Place Your Bets|date=October 27, 2010|first=Paul|last=Grein|work=Chart Watch|publisher=[[Yahoo! Music]]. [[Yahoo!]]|accessdate=October 29, 2010}} As of April 2011, the EP is ''Glee''{{'s}} lowest-selling in the US, with 160,000 copies.{{Cite web|url=http://new.music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart_watch/74357/week-ending-april-24-2011-albums-real-or-tv/|title=Week Ending April 24, 2011. Albums: Real Or TV?|date=April 27, 2011|first=Paul|last=Grein|work=Chart Watch|publisher=[[Yahoo! Music]]|accessdate=April 27, 2011}} ==Track listing== {{Track listing | all_writing = [[Richard O'Brien]] | title1 = [[Science Fiction/Double Feature|Science Fiction Double Feature]] | length1 = 4:28 | title2 = [[Dammit Janet|Damn It, Janet]] | length2 = 2:41 | title3 = [[Hot Patootie – Bless My Soul|Whatever Happened to Saturday Night?]] (featuring [[John Stamos]]) | length3 = 3:04 | title4 = [[Sweet Transvestite]] | length4 = 2:59 | title5 = [[Touch-a, Touch-a, Touch-a, Touch Me|Touch a Touch a Touch a Touch Me]] | length5 = 2:29 | title6 = [[Over at the Frankenstein Place|There's a Light (Over at the Frankenstein Place)]] | length6 = 2:33 | title7 = [[Time Warp (song)|Time Warp]] | length7 = 3:13 }} ==Credits and personnel== Persons credited for the project are as follows.{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=glee-the-music-the-rocky-horror-glee-show-r2027059/credits|pure_url=yes}}|title=Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=[[allmusic]]. [[Rovi Corporation]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} *[[Adam Anders]] – [[Musical arrangement|arranger]]; [[Audio engineering|engineer]]; [[Record producer|producer]]; soundtrack producer; [[vocals]] *Alex Anders – engineer *Nikki Anders – vocals *[[Peer Åström]] – arranger; engineer; [[Audio mixing (recorded music)|mixing]]; producer *Dave Bett – [[art direction]] *Per Björling – arranger *PJ Bloom – [[music supervisor]] *Geoff Bywater – [[Music executive|executive in charge of music]] *Deyder Cintron – assistant engineer *Kamari Copeland – vocals *Tim Davis – vocal arrangement; vocal contractor; vocals *[[Dante Di Loreto]] – soundtrack executive producer *[[Brad Falchuk]] – soundtrack executive producer *Heather Guibert – coordination *Missi Hale – vocals {{col-2}} *Tobias Kampe-Flygare - vocals *[[Storm Lee]] – vocals *David Loucks – vocals *Meaghan Lyons – coordination *Dominick Maita – [[Audio mastering|mastering]] *Maria Paula Marulanda – art direction *[[Ryan Murphy (writer)|Ryan Murphy]] – producer; soundtrack producer *[[Richard O'Brien]] – [[composer]] *Martin Persson – arranger; [[orchestration]]; [[Programming (music)|programming]] *Stefan Persson – string arrangements *Patrick Randak – [[photography]] *Federico Ruiz – [[design]] *Jenny Sinclair – coordination *Windy Wagner – vocals {{col-end}} ==Release history== {|class="wikitable" |- !Country !Release date !Formats ([[Compact Disc|CD]], [[Music download|DD]]) !Ref. |- |[[Canada]] |October 19, 2010 |CD, DD |{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.ca/Rocky-Horror-Glee-Show-Various/dp/B0042NJ0NO/|title=Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=Amazon.ca|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://itunes.apple.com/ca/preorder/glee-the-music-the-rocky-horror/id395337246|title=Glee: The Music - The Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=[[iTunes Store]] Canada|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} |- |[[Germany]] |October 19, 2010 |CD |{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.de/Rocky-Horror-Glee-Show-Music/dp/B0042NJ0NO/|title=Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=Amazon.de|language=German|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} |- |[[Ireland]] |October 19, 2010 |DD |{{cite web|url=http://itunes.apple.com/ie/preorder/glee-the-music-the-rocky-horror/id395337246|title=Glee: The Music - The Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=[[iTunes Store]] Ireland|accessdate=October 23, 2010}} |- |[[United States]] |October 19, 2010 |CD, DD |{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0046756O8/|title=Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} |- |[[Japan]] |October 26, 2010 |CD |{{cite web|url=http://www.sonymusicshop.jp/m/item/itemShw.php?site=S&ima=5232&cd=00DX000079646|title=Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show(US輸入盤)|publisher=[[Sony Music Entertainment Japan]]|language=Japanese|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} |- |[[Australia]] |October 29, 2010 |CD, DD |{{cite web|url=http://www.sanity.com.au/products/2191265/Glee_The_Music_Rocky_Horror_Glee_Show|title=Glee The Music; Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=[[Sanity (music store)|Sanity]]|accessdate=October 15, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://itunes.apple.com/au/preorder/glee-the-music-the-rocky-horror/id395337246|title=Glee: The Music - The Rocky Horror Glee Show|publisher=[[iTunes Store]] Australia|accessdate=October 15, 2010}} |- |[[Taiwan]] |March 15, 2011 |CD |{{cite web|url=http://www.sonymusic.com.tw/album_info.php?al_prodno=88697796462|title=洛基恐怖秀 (迷你專輯) The Rocky Horror Show|publisher=[[Sony Music Entertainment]] (Taiwan)|language=Chinese|accessdate=June 6, 2011}} |} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.gleethemusic.com/us/music/glee-music-rocky-horror-glee-show-0 ''Glee: The Music, The Rocky Horror Glee Show''] at GleeTheMusic.com {{Glee}} {{Glee Cast}} {{The Rocky Horror Picture Show}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Glee The Music Rocky Horror Glee Show}} [[Category:Glee (TV series) albums]] [[Category:2010 EPs]] [[Category:2010 soundtracks]] [[Category:Columbia Records EPs]] [[Category:Covers EPs]] [[Category:English-language soundtracks]] [[Category:English-language EPs]] [[Category:Rocky Horror]] [[Category:Television soundtracks]]
